definition: erhua variant of 小攤|小摊[xiao3 tan1]

sentences.english: This way he thinks he can support small businesses, helping to provide employment opportunities for small stallholders.
sentences.chinese: 他认为，自己能给许多小企业和小摊贩提供工作机会。

sentences.english: Gangu County in the streets, a common one of the stalls selling fried potato chips.
sentences.chinese: 在甘谷县街头，常见一个个卖油炸洋芋片的小摊。

sentences.english: She was once a government clerk. (See how the Mugabe regime tried to bully the opposition into submission.)
sentences.chinese: 这位小摊贩曾是一名政府职员。

sentences.english: That includes people like labourers, street vendors and domestic workers.
sentences.chinese: 包括劳工，小摊贩和本地劳动者。

sentences.english: Intrendy shop windows, on little stands.
sentences.chinese: 在时髦的商场橱窗，在小摊儿上，都有。

sentences.english: Do you go to the mobile vendors instead of having meal in canteens of our school?
sentences.chinese: 你会去吃小摊上的食物以代替正餐吗？

sentences.english: Mei Mei found many people around booth when she out of town.
sentences.chinese: 出城的时候看见一个小摊边围了好多人。

sentences.english: She bought a hot dog from a stand on a street corner and wolfed it down.
sentences.chinese: 他从街角小摊上买了一个热狗，大口地吃了下去。

sentences.english: Small vendors sold cheesy trinkets and knock-off Olympic souvenirs.
sentences.chinese: 小摊贩销售着各种可爱的小饰物和奥运纪念品。

sentences.english: Why do you go to the stalls outside the east gate?
sentences.chinese: 你为什么去东门的小摊上吃东西？

sentences.english: Both urban and rural markets so far in the production of small vendors selling horse roll.
sentences.chinese: 至今在城乡集市均有小摊贩制作马打滚出售。

sentences.english: A small stall or stand for the display and sale of goods.
sentences.chinese: 一个陈列和出售商品的小摊或售货台。

definition: to set up a vendor's stall in the street
to set up a stall/to maintain a large staff and organization
